title: [Self-Directed] Neurophysiological Foundations of Sleep Homeostasis and Motor Learning Exploration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic neuroscience and sleep cycle theories, along with experimental design methodologies
context.additional_context: Course analyzing the correlation between slow-wave activity (SWA) during sleep and motor learning through lab-based learning, with enhanced data measurement and analysis using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain increased SWA (Slow Wave Activity) patterns during NREM sleep stages using experimental data.
Learners can quantitatively analyze the correlation between changes in motor learning task performance and SWA intensity.
Learners can interpret the association between c-fos/Arc protein expression and motor learning mechanisms using neuroscience experimental models.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
